subject: MockObjects and static methods
msgSnippet: I have been trying to use MockObjects (usually as a small inner class) to break the coupling between the test target and the multitude of things it depends on.
messageBody:
I have been trying to use MockObjects (usually as a small inner class)
to break the coupling between the test target and the multitude of
things it depends on. Unfortunately, we tend to use a lot of static
methods in our architecture. Soooo... since you can't override a
static method, I can't figure out how to mock out the dependencies.
Anyone have a good solution to this problem? The only one I could
think of was making stuff non-static.
Dave
dhanna@...
